intro: Eriostemon myoporoides subsp. acutus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriostemon, is a small shrub native to southeastern Australia. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine, glandular hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in native gardens.
